page.title: 12THE FOSSWAY NEAR CRUDWELL
page.content: The Fossway was{a Roman road.}It was called the Fossway because of the{deep {fossae or ditches}next to the road from which the building materials were dug.The Romans usually built their roads straight but if they came to a hill or mountain they would build round it.In this area the Fossway is {now a public footpath.}It runs diagonally through the area for about 2\ miles.The public are allowed to walk along the Fossway and there are several places where it is possible to have a{picnic.}There are lots of{wild {flowers}such as bluebells and cowslips and many{wild animals}live there.You may ride along the old road on {horseback.}The Fossway is rough in some places and after rain it is very muddy.{Walking along the Fossway is {very enjoyable.
